author: Odeinoichus
title: Best Character for Chima.
review:
Set #71223 Fun Pack Cragger: The second of three Legends of Chima Fun Packs and the most useful Cragger is one of the must own packs to 100% the game. (Unless you just want to use Hire-A-Hero, though I’ve always personally felt owning all the characters is more fun than just paying for them for thirty minutes in-game.)

Packaging

Cragger takes up the front of the packaging in a suitably menacing looking action pose. Everything else about the packaging is your standard Fun Pack design.

Parts

There’s some nice Chima specific parts in the set as well as a plain light grey/bley Astromech top, all of which are fairly common for folks who bought the Chima sets.

Minifigures

Cragger: There have been numerous versions of Cragger in his Fire Armour released through the Legends of Chima Theme, the print and torso colouring is altered here. We’ve got some nice pearl gold markings which is shared between him and Laval. This makes this variant of Cragger unique to this set and one to pick up if you’re looking to collect every version.

The build

Swamp Skimmer: Building this little vehicle was really fun, it uses the part to great effect and the steps were easy enough to follow along with.

Cragger’s Fireship: Taking the parts to make this second model is equally fun and satisfying especially when you get to the final step and see the full model and its imposing crocodile shape.

Croc Command Sub: This is just as fun as the other two to build and works on so many levels, the binocular elements do like to pop off a lot when you’re handling this in play though.

The completed model

Swamp Skimmer: An awesome little model that can actually accommodate a Minifigure, the driver has to stand and stoop over to reach the control bar, but it does work and matches the digital model perfectly.

Cragger’s Fireship: This thing looks really imposing with the menacing eyes effect perfected by Chima designers. Sadly it loses the proper scale and Minifigure pilot accommodations that the first model had.

Croc Command Sub: Compared to the Subma-Homer this is a much better looking submersible model, aside from the binocular elements being easy to dislodge it’s great fun to take off the toy tag and play with as a physical toy. It doesn’t quite match the digital design, but it does what it can with the parts supplied.

The Digital Content

The Adventure World: Cragger unlocks Chima World and as I noted in Laval’s review I am a huge fan of this Adventure World in LEGO Dimensions.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Cragger shares the CHI and Cracked LEGO Object destruction abilities of Laval, his unique abilities make him much more versatile however as he can Dive, has Hazard Protection and is needed for some puzzle solving under the water because of this. (Neither Laval or Eris can go under water to use the CHI Fountains in-game.)

Swamp Skimmer Travels on the Water, the Fireship model has a Special Attack and can Speed Boost and the Sub can, as expected, travel under the water. It can also Destroy Silver LEGO Objects while under water, so that’s pretty useful.

Overall opinion

Cragger is the must have Fun Pack out of the three from Legends of Chima because of the fact you need him to access underwater CHI puzzles. The three physical models of the Toy are all great to play with off and on the toy pad and make excellent little models to display in your Chima collection. I’d definitely recommend picking Cragger over the other two if you’re only interested in experiencing all LEGO Dimensions has to offer.
